sen.e: In the later Meiji period around 1900, kakushi nenbutsu existed as a secret society in some places, such as Nagoya, Gifu, Asakusa and Yokohama, and since its existence was regarded as problematic, a muckraking book on the system of its doctorines was published in order to wipe it out.
